workout_file.description: Strength training: A certain repetition of short and maximal efforts with the goal to increase neuromuscular recruitment and maximum specific strength.
workout_file.name: Week 2.2 - Strength

textevent.message: Welcome back to another strength workout in the 6 week Beginner FTP Builder Plan!
Let's get started with a progressive warmup again today and start loosening up.
We'll start off with 6min nice and easy at a comfortable cadence.
So, today we're going to be focusing on very short, but very intense sprints.
Similar to what we did last week.
Today though, we're aiming for 6 efforts, as opposed to 5 last week.
With the same goal of increasing your neuromuscular recruitment to improve specific strength.
Ideally, as we increase your neuromuscular recruitment, or how many fibers you can contract at one time...
You'll be able to increase the force applied to the pedal stroke and subsequently improve your power production.
We're aiming for 10sec again for the sprints, with a 1min and 50sec rest in between.
And, 2 sets of 6 reps makes up the workout :-)
10sec, then we're going to move up to zone 2 at a quick cadence. Aim for 95 RPM next.
Bring up the power and leg speed here.
Let's take a sip of fluid here as well. Remember, start drinking early and try to do so frequently.
That's halfway through this step in the warmup. Shake out the upper body a bit and release some of that tension.
In 10sec, we're going to move up again, and this time to zone 3.
Aim for an even faster cadence here of 100 RPM.
Coming up next, we're going to finish this warmup with a full gas sprint at 110+ RPM.
All right, start spinning those legs up FAST and get ready for big power!
GO GO GO!!
GREAT! That's it for today's warmup. Let's bring it down easy for a bit and get ready for the main set.
Take some deep breaths, and a few sips of fluid. We'll catch up with 1min to go.
All right in 1min, we have our first sprint effort. Ideally, these are best done with ERG off.
You can turn it off through the Zwift Companion app, or by pressing up on the keyboard.
This is ideal since ERG won't respond fast enough, and I want you to smash these!
After the sprint, you may turn ERG back on again for the rest break.
Speaking of the sprint, aim to do these seated to engage maximum muscular engagement and get into a big gear now.
Okay, ready? In 10 sec, SMASH IT! Big gear, and SLOW cadence going for MAX POWER.
Great work! You can turn ERG back on now if you'd like, but no worries if you do not want to.
Remember, we're only resting for 2min here, so use this wisely.
Focus on your breathing during the recoveries. Inhale deeply, and purposeful exhales.
All right, sprint effort #2 is coming up! ERG mode off again and get ready to GRIND it out.
Excellent! That's 2 down, 3 more to go. Doing these seated and at a slow cadence should feel a lot different.
And you should feel your hips and glutes working much more.
This is great since your glutes are where a good deal of your power comes from.
Get ready for another sprint!!
Beautiful effort! Hopefully, you're able to produce a little more power with each interval.
Let's take a few deep breaths again now, and a sip of fluids. We have 2 more to go.
Get back into that big gear again, almost GO time!
YES! That was a great one! Just 2 more to go, then we'll take a nice long rest.
Breathe, relax, and let go of the tension in your shoulders here.
Okay, ready? Grab those bars, grit those teeth, and CRUSH THIS!
Awesome! Just 1 more sprint effort to go then we'll take a nice long break.
How are your legs feeling? Experiencing 'jelly' legs is normal with these efforts.
Ready? ERG off, and get ready to SMASH!
Awesome! That's it for the first set. Let's take a nice full recovery now.
10min is a long time, but necessary to fully recover from those sprint efforts!
Let's continue on with the rest break here. Focusing again on your breathing and shaking the legs out.
We'll catch up with 1min to go.
Okay, set #2 is just 1min away! We're going to repeat the first set again.
So again, aiming for BIG power, but SLOW cadence, with ERG OFF.
Stay seated again for these for maximum neuromuscular recruitment.
Okay, ready? Turn ERG off and get back into that huge gear! SLOW cadence again for these.
Great work! ERG back on, or off, your call :-)
Let's take about 2min in between sprints again here.
All right, sprint effort #2 is coming up! ERG mode off again and get ready to GRIND it out.
Great work! Don't worry if you are struggling to produce as much power at the lower cadences
As velocity decreases, so does power, unless force is increased. Power = Force x Velocity :-)
Keep focused on those glutes, baby.
Get ready for another sprint!!
Excellent work! That's halfway done with these.
Let's take a few deep breaths again here.
Get back into that big gear again...Get ready to grind it out!
Just 2 more to go! Can you make these final 2 your best ones?
Breathe, relax, and let go of the tension in your shoulders here.
Okay, ready? Grab those bars, grit those teeth, and CRUSH THIS!
1 more to go! Empty the tanks with this one!
Breathe...Start getting amped up to SMASH this finale.
Ready? ERG off, and get ready to SMASH!
Awesome! That's it for today, my friend! Let's start cooling down now.
We're going to take another 10min super easy to really spin the legs out
Keep on sipping those fluids throughout this cool down and take some nice deep breaths.
Experiencing some soreness is normal after a workout like today, especially with 2 extra sprints :-)
Try to get in some extra protein, and increase your sleep if you can to aid in recovery.
Great job again today! Enjoy the rest of this cool down and we'll see you next time!
